function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inadequate air mixing in rooms with a mixing ventilation system may result in atypical distribution of micro-organisms, increasing infection risk.","Impact":"Increased risk of virus transmission and infection due to uneven air distribution of micro-organisms.","Mitigation":"Conduct further study on indoor air mixing and airflow patterns to better understand virus transmission patterns.","Technologies":"Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations, air distribution effectiveness factor, HEPA filters.","People":"Occupants of buildings with mixing ventilation systems.","Owner":"Researchers, building designers, HVAC engineers."},{"Description":"Limited investigation of the effects of HEPA filters on ventilation grills and in real-world settings may lead to incomplete understanding of their efficacy in reducing viral transmission.","Impact":"Inadequate knowledge about the effectiveness of HEPA filters in reducing viral transmission in various indoor environments.","Mitigation":"Conduct more comprehensive studies on the effects of HEPA filters in different indoor spaces and settings.","Technologies":"HEPA filters, air filtration systems, indoor air quality monitoring.","People":"Occupants of indoor spaces where HEPA filters are used.","Owner":"Researchers, HVAC engineers, facility managers."},{"Description":"Insufficient understanding of virus transmission patterns in various indoor spaces, including restaurants, houses, classrooms, and gyms, may lead to ineffective infection control measures.","Impact":"Increased risk of virus transmission due to inadequate understanding of virus transmission patterns in specific indoor environments.","Mitigation":"Conduct extensive studies on virus transmission patterns in various indoor spaces to develop tailored infection control measures.","Technologies":"Indoor air quality monitoring, virus transmission modeling, environmental sensors.","People":"Occupants and visitors of specific indoor spaces such as restaurants, houses, classrooms, and gyms.","Owner":"Researchers, public health authorities, facility managers."}]}
